bibl.title: Gemellos and His Animal Farm: Full Edition of P.Fay. 253 descr.
Papyrological Texts in Honor of Roger S. Bagnall

bibl.note: Euheremeia, end of the 1st or beginning of the 2nd cent. AD. The account, probably written by Epagathos, shows that Gemellos owned at least four teams of bulls (ταυρικά) and four teams of cows (βοϊκά), and that the business of lending them out brought him a high profit.
bibl.seg: 141.4 P. Pennsylvania Univ. Mus. Inv. 2777; 2777A; 2777b = P. Fay. 253 descr. = P. Bagnall 4
Giuseppina Azzarello & Fabian Reiter, Gemellos and His Animal Farm: Full Edition of P.Fay. 253 descr.

Rodney Ast, Hélène Cuvigny, Todd M. Hickey & Julia Lougovaya (edd.), Papyrological Texts in Honor of Roger S. Bagnall = American Studies in Papyrology. 53 (Durham, North Carolina, 2013) pp. 21-30, 4 figg.

Euheremeia, end of the 1st or beginning of the 2nd cent. AD. The account, probably written by Epagathos, shows that Gemellos owned at least four teams of bulls (ταυρικά) and four teams of cows (βοϊκά), and that the business of lending them out brought him a high profit.
